item.description:
I am a (Boya) Postdoctoral Researcher in National Institute of Health Data Science at Peking University working with Prof. Luxia Zhang . Before that, I was a Postdoctoral Researcher at Georgia Institute of Technology working with Prof. Jimeng Sun from Sep. 2019 to Aug. 2020, a Visiting Researcher at Harvard Medical School working with Prof. M. Brandon Westover from Feb. 2020 to Aug. 2020. I obtained my Ph.D. degree from Peking University under the supervision of Prof. Hongyan Li in 2019, and B.S. degree from Beijing University of Posts and Telecommunications in 2014.

My research interests are data mining and artificial intelligence algorithms for healthcare, especially deep learning methods on temporal medical data – such as temporal events, time series (e.g. longitudinal data, electronic health records, claims data), and physiological signals (e.g. electrocardiogram, electroencephalogram, polysomnogram, heart rates). I serve as a program committee member or reviewer for international conferences including IJCAI, AAAI, NeurIPS, ICLR and ICML. I also led a team that won the first place of the 18th PhysioNet/Computing in Cardiology Challenge .
